resources.string: Long press on list item to delete.
All values must be greater than 0.
Degrees are greater than 0 and less than 180.

Approximate radii for 90 degree cold bend aluminum alloy. Each entry is a range where t is the thickness of material. For example, 1100-H12 aluminum alloy ½ inch thick can be bent 1t-3t or around a ½ to 1 ½ inch radius die.
This will delete all the current bend deduction entries.
There are no email clients installed
Nothing to show, lets get started by hitting the top left menu button, calculating some bends and building some parts!
Bend deduction: The bend deduction is the difference between the bend allowance and twice the outside setback.

Sheet Metal Mechanic can calculate the dimensions of a flat pattern for a single bend application. Input the appropriate variables, angle (A), radius (R), material thickness (MT), leg A and leg B to calculate the total blank size and the center of the bend. For use with punch and die press brake machines.

When calculating a flange with one bend, for example a right angle, subtract one half a bend deduction from each leg to calculate the total flat dimension. For calculating a flat with a bend on either side, for example a channel, subtract half a deduction for each bend or one deduction.

Sheet Metal Mechanic calculates bend allowance using the following Empirical formula.

		Bend Allowance(BA) = (.01742R + .0078)A°

Then using bend allowance value calculates bend deduction using the following.

		Bend Deduction(BD) = 2(r+t) x Tan(A°/2) - BA
Thank you for giving Sheet Metal Mechanic a try! If you have any questions, comments, or suggestions, please send me an email, I would appreciate the feedback.

1. Please read and understand any applicable operating manuals, taking note of all warnings and cautions. The calculations contained within this application are in a “as is” state and are to be considered “Reference only”. Please verify all calculations with appropriate approved data and or standard shop practices.
 2. Mechanical Movement Danger: Mechanical movement of the ram and back gauge assembly. Be aware of their movement and stay away from the points of operation. 
 3. Press brake should only be operated by authorized personnel who have been trained by an authorized individual. 
 4. Never eliminate or by-pass any safety devices. 
 5. Never make adjustments, repairs, replacements or leave machine unattended with the power "ON". 
6. Do not use machine if servicing is required. 
 7. Use safety glasses, safety shoes, required protective tools and appropriate personnel protective equipment. 
 8. Keep work areas clean and in proper order. 
 9. Always stay alert to all potential hazards. Never become careless or over confident. 
 10. Do not grasp metal sheet with fingers or thumbs on top. If wide sheets need support, keep hands below with open palms, and fingers and thumbs underneath. Remember that the material will travel upward — keep all parts of the body clear of this movement. 
 11. When inspecting or changing hydraulic components, make certain the ram is securely blocked or resting on a die, with pressure relieved from system.
